Assamese, Bodo, English, Economics, Education, History, Geography & Pol. Science

Regular Course

Subjects:

Assamese, Bodo, English, Economics, Education, History, Geography & Pol. Science

What is UG-CBSC ?

The undergraduate degree (UG) programme in the Choice Based Credit System (CBCS) will have courses spread across six-semesters of any undergraduate degree course. Two consecutive (one odd and one even) semesters will make up an academic year. An UG course shall be of Six Semesters covering three Calendar Years (Academic Sessions- June to May). The duration of the Odd Semesters (First, Third and Fifth) shall be June-November, and that of Even Semesters (Second, Fourth and Sixth) shall be December – May.

The Notion of Credit

A student needs to earn a required number of credits in order to successfully complete a degree. The credit is closely related to the number of stipulated classes a student has to complete. The following table indicates the number of credit a student can earn for each type of indicated classes.

Papers and Credit

The following table gives you an idea about the numbers and papers one must take in a certain degree course and the total credit contains

ADMISSION

A. ELIGIBILITY-

Degree course in six-semester : A candidate must pass higher secondary examination of Assam Higher Secondary Education Council or equivalent examination recognised by Guwahati University.

B. PROCEDURE-

Admission will be on merit basis candidates seeking admission shall have to produce the following original document at the time of admission.

Marks Sheet of the Last Examinations passed

Age Certificate.

Two copies of recent passport size photographs.

Character Certificate from the Head of the Institution last attended.

Caste Certificate.(ST/SC/OBC/MOBC).

Migration Certificate(for students migrating from a Board/Council/University other than AHSEC/GU).

Gap Certificate for candidates who passed the qualifying examination earlier then, 2019.

OTHER COURSES OFFERED IN THE COLLEGE

COURSE INFORMATION

POST GRADUATE DIPLOMA IN COMPUTER APPLICATION (PGDCA)

Regulations for one year PGDCA (Post Graduate Diploma in Computer Application) Under Gauhati University to be conducted by the affiliated colleges under G.U.

Duration

The duration of the course shall be one year consisting of two semesters

ADMISSION :

Admission to the first semester course shall take place twice in a year in the month of August and in the month of December. For the batch admitted on August, the 1st semester classes will start from 1st of September and the 1st semester examination shall be completed by the middle of December. For the batch admitted on December the 1st Semester classes shall start from 1st January and the 1st Semester examination shall be completed by the middle of June. The second semester classes and examination will also follow the same pattern.

ELIGIBILITY:

A student with a bachelor’s degree in 10+2+3 pattern preferably students having mathematics at the Higher Secondary level and obtaining minimum pass mark in the subject be admitted to the course Or Certificate Or Diploma in computer for students not having Mathematics at the higher secondary level.

PROCEDURE :

Admission will be on merit basis. Candidates seeking admission shall have to attached photocopy of the following documents at the time of submission of application form & Candidate have to produce original documents at the time of admission.

Photocopy of documents to be submitted with application

Mark Sheets of examination passed.

Age certificate.

Two copies of recent passport size photograph

Character certificate from the Head of the Institution last attended.

Caste certificate along with photocopy of the same.

Migration certificate (for students migrating from a Board/Council/ University other then AHSEC/G.U) with a photocopy of the same.

DATE OF ADMISSION TO BE ANNOUNCED

FEES (SEMESTER) TO BE PAID AT THE TIME OF ADMISSION

Migration fees for the students migrated from other University will be according to the fees of Gauhati University.

KRISHNA KANT HANDIQUI STATE OPEN UNIVERSITY

COURSE OFFERED BY STUDY CENTRE OF THE KRISHNA KANTA HANDIQUE STATE OPEN UNIVERSITY, GUWAHATI (KHOIRABARI COLLEGE)

Bachelor of Arts ( B.A)

ELIGIBILITY:

The eligibility criteria for the admission into Bachelor of Arts (B.A), (Major & Pass) are as follows : Those who have passed Higher Secondary / Pre-University examination in any stream and those who have passed relevant BBP from KKHSOU are eligible to take admission in any of BA programme. Candidate who have passed BBP from IGNOU or any other open university will eligible to take admission in any of the degree programmes. But such candidates shall have to pass the programme specific courses of BBP of this university for which they will have to take admission into BPP simultaneously.

STUDENT’S WELFARE SCHEME

It becomes a traditional that every academic session, students elect a body and manages the welfare activities of the students as per the rules of the union under the guidance of the teacher-in-charge. Our elected body is known as “Khoirabari College Student’s Union body and every admitted students of this college is the member of this union body.

In every academic session, the college arranges various co-curricular activities, i.e. debate, extempore speech, spot writing, recitation, cultural competition including sports and games competition.

COUNSELLING CELL

The college has a counselling cell and every year in the last week of June and again in the first week of august, two counselling classes arrange for the students only to inform them about the approaching challenges of their carrier. Besides, the cell is always pro-active to help the students whenever they need information and guidance.
